alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 2:34AM EST until February 07 at 3:40AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Milledgeville affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Baldwin Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Milledgeville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Milledgeville. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24 feet, Minor flooding continues upstream and downstream from the gage located around one half mile upstream from the Georgia Highway 22 and 24 bridge. The parking lot and portions of the Oconee River Greenway Park just downstream from the bridge will be flooded. Low lying areas of woodlands and pasture near the river will be flooded one to two feet deep. Sinclair Dam will likely have two gates open to reach this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 AM EST Saturday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning to 23.6 feet - Flood stage is 22 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.4 feet on 04/03/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
